title: 发言稿
content:
Hello everyone, my name is Yan Liu. It is a great honor to join the conversation today, sharing insights into one of the most dynamic forces that shape our digital future—China’s data industry—and how we can contribute. I’m the Technical Lead for the CFIEC IDS Testing Project.
We all know how important data is, and how much value we can create through data sharing activities, particularly in the case of using data space. This is the fundamental reason we’re gathered here today.
In addition, the data volume will skyrocket by 2025, with a staggering 26.3% growth, which makes China a dominant force in driving the digital economy. As a result, I believe our role is to align the synergies and make IDS-minded data space part of the grand plan.
With that, over the next 10 minutes, I’ll walk you through how exactly we can fulfill that potential and how we can bridge those divides.
In a dataspace, "trustworthiness" is fundamental. A trustworthy dataspace must be supported by verifiable identities, controlled data usage, and auditable operational behaviors.
Guided by the principles of IDSA, CFIEC actively promotes the localization and validation of key components in China—such as connectors, identity management, and usage control—to build a truly trusted interconnection.
As the Project Lead of the CFIEC testing initiative, I am leading the team in building a dual-track capability system that covers both component certification and operational environment certification.
In our view, certification is not just a technical evaluation—it is a guarantee of trust. We are helping Chinese enterprises gain a deeper understanding of the dataspace concept and promoting fair and accurate evaluation of Chinese solutions.
More importantly, I want to emphasize that we are not just learners, but also contributors. We are feeding Chinese scenarios, Chinese needs, and Chinese insights back into the IDSA standards framework, driving IDS certification from being merely technologically advanced to being truly globally adaptable—making it more complete, and more genuinely international.
We all know that the Internet's ability to transcend borders and connect the world is not driven by a single technology, but by standardization and consensus. From the establishment of the TCP/IP protocols, to the rise of the World Wide Web, and the large-scale deployment of IPv6, every technological leap has been underpinned by a restructuring of global rules. As the Co-Chair of the IPv6 Ready Logo International Certification Committee, I am not only a witness to the global IPv6 certification system—but also an active driver behind it.
Today, over 65% of all IPv6 Ready certifications worldwide come from the lab I lead. This is not only an acknowledgment of our capabilities by the industry, but also a recognition of our voice in the international community.
I understand clearly what a global certification system truly needs to solve, and how to build a structure that defines "who sets the rules."
More importantly, I understand that certification for dataspaces will be the next main arena in the global trust landscape.
I will bring all the experience, methodologies, and influence I've gained from building the IPv6 international certification system fully into the development of the IDSA certification framework. What we aim to build is not just a technical platform—it is a foundational global infrastructure for trusted data exchange. It must withstand validation across global scenarios, reflect voices from the frontlines of industry, and most critically, earn global trust, with results that are respected, processes that are followed, and standards that are referenced worldwide.
In my view, any certification system that truly holds international competitiveness must possess three core capabilities: an automated testing toolchain, a scientific and rigorous methodology, and a globally adaptable framework design. I am leading the development of a comprehensive certification system that covers both connectors and operational environments, with a clear goal: to integrate all test cases from the standard catalog that can be automated into a unified, high-efficiency testing framework, achieving a system-level restructuring.
We aim not only for comprehensive coverage, but also for precision, efficiency, and zero error. Our testing tools are undergoing continuous validation and rapid iteration, ensuring that every result meets the standards of consistency, repeatability, and internationally recognized trustworthiness.
At the same time, I must emphasize that the future certification system will inevitably revolve around DSP. DSP serves as the technological hub of the trusted framework for the entire data space, determining the boundaries and capabilities of identity verification, policy enforcement, data exchange, and even interoperability. I will also dedicate my efforts to advancing the comprehensive implementation of the DSP standard certification system in China and globally.
Let us work together to define, build, and operate the IDS testing and certification process. I am willing to take on greater responsibility in this endeavor, contributing experience, driving transformation, and ensuring concrete actions.
Thank you!
